member_organisations:
LINK : http://free-group.eu/free-group-members/ 
 
FREE Group Members (situation as of September 1st 25, 2015) 
 
The Fundamental Rights European Experts Group (FREE Group)  is a Belgian non governmental organisation (Association Sans But Lucratif (ASBL) Registered at Belgian Moniteur: Number 304811. 
 
According to art 3 and 4 of its Statute ( see below *) the association focus is on monitoring, teaching and advocating in the European Union freedom security and justice related policies. In the same framework we follow also the EU actions in protecting and promoting EU values and fundamental rights in the Member States as required by the article 2, 6 and 7 of the Treaty on the European Union (risk of violation by a Member State of EU founding values)

fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Customs, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, External Relations, Digital economy and society, Borders and Security, Communication
eu_initiatives:
Freedom security and justice area (FSJA) related policies as dealt with by the LIBE, JURI and AFCO parliamentary commitees as well as by the EC DG Home and JUST (Directorate General H in the Council). 
FREE Group follows the strategic, legislative and operational aspects of the EU Institutions, Agencies and bodies active in the FSJA as well as the implementation of the European Charter of Fundamental rights..
organisation_name: Fundamental Rights European Experts Group (FREE Group)
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
membership:
FREE Group, has strong cooperation with: 
- Fondazione Lelio Liesli BASSO in Rome 
- Statewatch (UK) 
- Meijeers Committee (NL) 
- EDRI (BE) 
- Transparency International (BE) 
- EPIC (USA)
relevant_communication: The main events in 2017 have been the participation to a Summer School on the Freedom Security and Justice Area in Naples (Castellamare di Stabia) in July as well as to a Conference at the European Institute in Florence on the same subject in November 23/24. Another International Conference has been organized in Washington on March 23-24 within the George Washington University thanks to a Free-Group Member, Francesca Bignami. The cooperation with Statewatch, Fondazione Basso, EDRI and Mejiers Committee has been confirmed.
goals__remit:
The Fundamental Rights European Experts Group (FREE Group)  is a Belgian non governamental organisation (Association Sans But Lucratif (ASBL) Registered at Belgian Moniteur: Number 304811.  
According to art 3 and 4 of its Statute (*) the association focus is on monitoring, teaching and advocating in the European Union freedom security and justice related policies. In the same framework we follow also the EU actions in protecting and promoting EU values and fundamental rights in the Member States as required by the article 2, 6 and 7 of the Treaty on the European Union (see the Hungarian case).  
 
(*) (ORIGINAL FRENCH VERSION) TITREII  (DU BUT SOCIAL POURSUIVI) 
Article 3 
L'association a pour but la recherche, la diffusion de l'information et I'enseignement dans le domaine de la mise en ouvre de l'espace européen de liberté, sécurité et justice (ELSJ) et des droits fondamentaux tels que définis par Part. 6 du Traite sur l'Union européenne, y compris les droits contenus dans des traites internationaux mis en oeuvre en droit européen. 
Elle peut accomplir tous les actes se rapportant directement ou indirectement a son but. 
Elle peut notamment prêter son concours et s'intéresser a toute activité similaire a son but de la part d'autres 
associations, réseaux travaillant sur base régional ou thématique dans les domaines de l'ELSJ. 
Article 4 
L'association a pour objets : 
a)    la recherche scientifique, 1'expertise et la consultance; 
b)    1'organisation de programmes d'enseignement ou de formation ; 
c)    la publication d'ouvrages; 
d)    1'organisation de congres ou de conférences, 
e)    la réalisation de missions sur place 
f)    la promotion d'association avec des buts similaires dans chaque Etats membre de I'UE ou d'autres pays intéresses au développement de l'ELSJ
